intro: Sisymbrium turritoides, commonly known as the turban mustard, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its distinctive turban-shaped seed pods. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in early spring, followed by the development of its unique, inflated seed pods. Sisymbrium turritoides is often found in disturbed soils and can be a common weed in agricultural areas.
